name: CTPulmonaryAngiogramCTPA
title: CT Pulmonary Angiogram CTPA
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value set contains concepts that represent a computed tomography (CT) pulmonary angiogram, or a CT for pulmonary embolism.),(Data Element Scope: This value set may use the Quality Data Model (QDM) category related to Diagnostic Study.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes only relevant concepts associated with a CT pulmonary angiogram, CT of the chest which may be used to show pulmonary embolus, and other related concepts.),(Exclusion Criteria: No exclusions.)

contains.display: CT Chest W contrast IV
CT Chest WO and W contrast IV
CTA Chest vessels WO and W contrast IV
Introduction of catheter, right heart or main pulmonary artery
Selective catheter placement, left or right pulmonary artery
CTA Pulmonary arteries W contrast IV
CTA Chest vessels W contrast IV
Computed tomography, thorax, diagnostic; with contrast material(s)
Computed tomography, thorax, diagnostic; without contrast material, followed by contrast material(s) and further sections
Computed tomographic angiography, chest (noncoronary), with contrast material(s), including noncontrast images, if performed, and image postprocessing
CT Pulmonary arteries for pulmonary embolus
Angiography, pulmonary, unilateral, selective, radiological supervision and interpretation
Angiography, pulmonary, bilateral, selective, radiological supervision and interpretation
Angiography, pulmonary, by nonselective catheter or venous injection, radiological supervision and interpretation
CTA Pulmonary arteries for pulmonary embolus W contrast IV
CTA Pulmonary arteries - bilateral and Pelvis veins and Lower extremity veins - bilateral for pulmonary embolus and deep vein thrombosis W contrast IV
CTA Coronary arteries and Pulmonary arteries W contrast IV
CTA Coronary arteries and Pulmonary arteries and Thoracic aorta W contrast IV

CTA Pulmonary arteries - bilateral and Lower extremity veins - bilateral for pulmonary embolus and deep vein thrombosis
